p: In complement to the mechanism proposed above, increased lung inflammatory protease (neutrophil elastase and metalloprotease) activity has been demonstrated in ARDS ( 78, 79), with a concomitant imbalance between protease and protease inhibitors activity ( 80). In addition, although not yet measured, to our knowledge, in SARS murine models, we and others have shown increased protease-mediated lung damage in mice infected with Influenza ( 81â€“ 83). Additionally, in a MERS-CoV murine model, it was shown that excessive complement activation was partly responsible for exacerbated lung inflammation ( 84).
